title: Decay particles - compare alpha and beta-plus KE

content.question: Two nuclei undergo spontaneous radioactive decay. One nucleus emits an alpha particle and the other emits a beta-plus particle. If the emitted particles have the same speed, which of the following correctly relates the kinetic energies <math alttext="K sub alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>α</mi></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="K sub beta-plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>β</mi><mo>+</mo></mrow></msub></math> of the alpha and beta-plus particles, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub alpha is much greater than K sub beta-plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>α</mi></msub><mo>≫</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>β</mi><mo>+</mo></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub alpha is much less than K sub beta-plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>α</mi></msub><mo>≪</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>β</mi><mo>+</mo></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub alpha equals K sub beta-plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>α</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>β</mi><mo>+</mo></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K sub alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>α</mi></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="K sub beta-plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>β</mi><mo>+</mo></mrow></msub></math> are within a factor of ten of each other, but are not equal.

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub alpha is much greater than K sub beta-plus" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>α</mi></msub><mo>≫</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mrow><mi>β</mi><mo>+</mo></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
